results.title: Maidenhead
results.brief_description: Maidenhead is a series of chamber-fictions inhabited by a young woman named Alice. Linked in an oblique, dream like way, these short, sharp stories describe Alice’s survival in an everyday world of bizarre logic and strange emotions. It’s a place where miracles unfold in the bathroom and desire appears on a bus; where menacing joggers roam the suburbs and there’s something sinister about hats. Vibrant like musical, Maidenhead is at once funny and disquieting, poignant and absurd.

results.title: Ship No. 76
results.brief_description: Shows all stages of the construction of the 18,600 ton oil tanker, B.P. Endeavour, at the Newcastle State Dockyard. The Endeavour was the largest ship built in Australia up to 1967.

results.title: Grampians wonderland
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria, David Swift and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description:
The Grampians mountain ranges rising from the plains of western Victoria were discovered by Major Mitchell and continue to delight tourists. This program shows the exquisite wildflowers, the animal life, the rugged mountain scenery and the foaming waterfalls which make the Grampians so beautiful and so popular. Winner of an AFI Award: 1959.

The convertable car used in this film is a Triumph TR3A.

results.title: Day at the Show
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: A visit to Melbourne’s Royal Show. Commentary designed for children showing the animals, pavilions, motor displays, show bags, fun fair and the grand parade ending with a fireworks display.

results.title: The Simpson automa-boot
results.brief_description: This film is an amusing animated cartoon made by Form I students from Moorabbin Technical College. It follows the activities of an “automatic boot” which takes the user wherever they may wish to go in a fantasy world. The producer’s aim was to give the students an opportunity for creative work in which cooperation between students, descriptive writing, animation of the human form and self-disclipine would be required. Animation by Colin Jenkins and Andrew Mougemore. Painters - Neil Stevenson, Tony McFarland, Steven Witcraft, Dave Harmo, Emily McPherson, Trevor Williams.

results.title: The Daydreamer
results.brief_description: An example of independent Melbourne film production. A young man watching a girl pass by his window, imagines himself the hero in a series of fantastic situations in which the maiden’s honour is threatened by diverse evil characters. Made by Michael Martin, assisted by Garry Martin, Bruce McNaughton and Doug Hobbs.

results.title: Coma
results.creator_credit: British Petroleum, St John Ambulance Australia and Ray Argall
results.brief_description:
Coma can be caused by epilspsy, drowning, drug overdose or head injuries. Shows what to do for people in a deep coma. The victim should be moved into the approved coma position until medical help arrives. It is the only treatment that a first aider can and should apply.

PLEASE NOTE: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date first-aid practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Natural Glass
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Derek Wright and John King
results.brief_description: Looks at a one-man revival of “natural” glass-making in New Zealand, contrasting the delicacies of glass making by one man with his normal job as a worker in a natural gas field.

results.title: This was Chadstone
